heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 21 September 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (191°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 4.6°C) and feels like temperature (down 3.4°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 49.8°C), feels like temperature (up 53.2°C), outside temperature (up 52.9°C), and cloud levels (up 443 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 772.8m lower than yesterday, 443.3m lower than the past week, 15.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 1078m to a maximum of 4940m, averaging 1717.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 2160m and 1732.1m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and winds will be practically absent. Chance of light rain, occasional overcast conditions, and it’s dim outside. Little change in the weather.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (3.6°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
